description: High-yield corn variety with excellent drought resistance and strong stalks.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Corn kernel absorbs moisture and begins to swell. Root emergence occurs within 5-7 days under optimal conditions.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: Seedling emerges from soil with first leaves (coleoptile). Root system establishes and first true leaves appear.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Rapid growth phase with leaf development and stalk elongation. Plants reach full height and develop extensive root systems.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Tassels emerge and shed pollen. Silks appear on ears and pollination occurs. Critical period for yield determination.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Kernels fill and mature. Moisture content decreases to harvest levels (15-20%). Plants reach physiological maturity.

description: Premium soybean variety with high protein content and disease resistance.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Soybean seed imbibes water and begins germination process. Radical emergence occurs within 3-5 days.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: Cotyledons emerge above soil surface. First true leaves unfold and photosynthesis begins.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Node development and trifoliate leaf formation. Branching occurs and nitrogen fixation begins through root nodules.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Flower clusters form at leaf axils. Self-pollination occurs and pod development begins.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Pods fill with mature beans. Leaves yellow and drop as plants prepare for harvest.

description: Winter wheat variety with excellent cold tolerance and high gluten content.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Wheat seed germinates in cool fall conditions. Primary root and shoot development begins.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: First leaves emerge and tillering begins. Plant establishes crown roots before winter dormancy.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Winter dormancy period followed by spring growth resumption. Stem elongation and additional tillering occur.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Heading occurs as flower spikes emerge. Pollination and grain formation begin during this critical period.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Grain filling and ripening phase. Moisture content decreases and grains harden for harvest readiness.

description: High-quality alfalfa with excellent hay production and protein levels.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Small alfalfa seeds require adequate moisture for germination. Root development is crucial for establishment.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: Seedlings develop first true leaves. Taproot begins deep penetration into soil layers.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Continuous growth with multiple harvests possible. Crown development and extensive root system establishment.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Purple flowers appear in clusters. Peak nutritional value occurs just before full bloom.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Seed pods develop if allowed to mature. Plants prepare for dormancy or regrowth cycle.

description: Fast-growing barley variety ideal for brewing and livestock feed.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Barley grain absorbs moisture rapidly. Quick germination in cool spring conditions.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: First leaves emerge and tillering begins early. Root system establishes quickly in favorable conditions.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Rapid vegetative growth with multiple tillers. Plants develop strong stems and extensive leaf area.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Heads emerge and flowering occurs. Critical period for grain number determination.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Grain filling and ripening complete. Awns (if present) dry and heads become golden for harvest.

description: Large-head sunflower variety with high oil content and bird resistance.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Large sunflower seeds germinate in warm summer soil. Substantial energy reserves support early growth.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: Cotyledons emerge followed by first true leaves. Strong taproot development begins immediately.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Rapid height gain and large leaf development. Stem thickens to support eventual large flower head.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Large flower head develops with thousands of individual flowers. Tracking sun movement (heliotropism) occurs.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Seeds develop and mature in the head. Oil content reaches maximum and heads face downward.

description: High-yielding oat variety with excellent grain quality and lodging resistance.

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Oat seeds germinate well in cool, moist spring conditions. Quick emergence is typical.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: First leaves appear and tillering begins. Plants establish strong root systems early.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Vegetative growth with tiller development. Plants remain relatively short with broad leaves.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Open panicle heads emerge with pendant flowers. Wind pollination occurs during this phase.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Grain filling completes and oats ripen. Hulled grains develop characteristic oat appearance.

description: Aromatic rice variety with excellent cooking quality and disease resistance.

plantingRequirements.soilType: Clay soil with good water retention

growthStages.name: Seed
growthStages.description: Rice seeds germinate in flooded or very moist conditions. Pre-germination soaking may be used.

growthStages.name: Germination
growthStages.description: Seedlings develop in nursery beds or direct seeding. Strong root systems adapt to flooded conditions.

growthStages.name: Vegetative
growthStages.description: Tillering and stem elongation in flooded fields. Plants develop ability to transport oxygen to roots.

growthStages.name: Flowering
growthStages.description: Panicles emerge above water with small flowers. Self-pollination occurs and grain formation begins.

growthStages.name: Maturity
growthStages.description: Grains mature and fields are drained. Rice reaches optimal moisture content for harvest.
